mdRecord.dcterms:creator: McGowan, John J.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Finds Buchanan acceptable as a possible candidate, but feels he will not get a third of the Irish vote; would not be able to support Pierce "under any circumstances"; desires some indication of the association's {IAEA] policy in this matter; disturbed by Messrs. Lumsden and Convoy's failure to respond to him on association business; trusts that Tyler's sister is recoverning from her illness. Autograph Letter Signed
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1856 May 19, John J. McGowan, New York, N.Y. to Robert Tyler
